page.title: 09MOTTRAM VILLAGE SCHOOL
page.content: The present school building at Mottram was constructed at the beginning of this century. At first it was an all age school, but in the 1940's became a county primary school. At present there are 52 children on roll ranging in age from 4+ to 11. Only 1/3 of the children come from the village and official catchment area. The remainder come from the surrounding towns of Alderley Edge, Wilmslow and Macclesfield _ the parents of these children opting to send their children to a village rather than a large town school. The teaching staff comprises of a head, two full_time teachers and one part_time teacher.There is a caretaker, a cook and canteen assistant, and three mid day assistants.
